10 Features The Hyundai Creta Electric Borrows From Its ICE Version - CarDekho
summary:
Hyundai Creta Electric vs The Creta: 10 Features Electric Version Borrows From ICE Model

Publication Date: Scheduled for January 17, 2025
Source: CarDekho.com

Hyundai has unveiled the features of the upcoming Creta Electric, which shares styling and cabin layout with the ICE-powered model. The report highlights ten key features focused on convenience and safety borrowed from the regular Creta.

  • Dual 10.25-inch screens for infotainment and digital driver display.
  • Panoramic sunroof available in both models.
  • 8-speaker Bose sound system for premium audio experience.
  • Ventilated front-row seats for comfort.
  • Dual-zone automatic climate control for personalized comfort.
  • Standard 6 airbags across all variants for safety.
  • 360-degree camera system for parking assistance.
  • Level-2 ADAS for advanced safety features.
  • All-wheel disc brakes with electronic parking brake.
  • Tyre pressure monitoring system for real-time alerts.
“Prices for the Hyundai Creta Electric are set to be announced on January 17, 2025, at the upcoming Bharat Mobility Expo.”

The Creta Electric aims to compete with models like Tata Curvv EV, MG ZS EV, and Maruti Suzuki e Vitara.

title: Big 4 in India outshine MNC parents; combined revenue seen at over Rs 45,000 crore in FY25 - The Economic Times
summary:
Big 4 in India outshine MNC parents; combined revenue seen at over Rs 45,000 crore in FY25

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Economic Times

The Indian arms of the Big Four consulting firms are projected to surpass Rs 45,000 crore in combined revenue in FY25, driven by significant growth in consulting services amidst a slowing economy.

  • The Indian affiliates of Deloitte, PwC, EY, and KPMG outpaced their global parents in FY24 revenue growth.
  • Estimated revenue for the Indian firms in FY24 was around Rs 38,500-38,800 crore.
  • Consulting services generated over Rs 25,000 crore for these firms in FY24.
  • EY is expected to grow 23-25% in FY25, with a focus on consulting services.
  • Tax services across firms generated over Rs 6,000 crore in FY24, with growth expected between 12% and 23% in FY25.
“We will grow 23-25% in FY25. For Deloitte India now, more than 60% of revenue comes from various consulting services.” - Romal Shetty, CEO, Deloitte South Asia.

The growth prospects remain strong for the Big Four in India, as they adapt to changing market demands while facing challenges related to workload management and revenue-sharing with global partners.
newTitle: Big 4 in India outshine MNC parents; combined revenue seen at over Rs 45,000 crore in FY25

title: Winklevoss Twins' Gemini Will Pay $5 Million to Settle CFTC Bitcoin Futures Lawsuit - Decrypt
summary:
Winklevoss Twins' Gemini Will Pay $5 Million to Settle CFTC Bitcoin Futures Lawsuit

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Decrypt

The Gemini Trust Company has agreed to a $5 million settlement with the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) to resolve allegations of misleading regulators regarding its Bitcoin futures product.

  • The settlement avoids a trial that was set for January 21, 2025.
  • Gemini did not admit to or deny any wrongdoing.
  • The CFTC filed the lawsuit accusing Gemini of making material false statements to obtain approval for its Bitcoin futures.
  • The lawsuit claimed Gemini should have known its statements were misleading.
  • Winklevoss twins have been influential in the crypto space and made donations to political campaigns.
“Gemini knew or reasonably should have known that the statements and information by the company were false or misleading.”

This settlement showcases the ongoing regulatory scrutiny in the cryptocurrency sector and the efforts by firms to comply with regulations.
newTitle: Winklevoss Twins' Gemini to Settle CFTC Case with $5 Million Payment

2025 Ather 450 Series Launched: All You Need To Know - News18
summary:
2025 Ather 450 Series Launched: All You Need To Know

Last Updated: January 06, 2025, 16:35 IST | Source: Ather Energy

The 2025 Ather 450 series has been launched with significant upgrades to enhance performance and safety features.

  • The Ather 450X and 450 Apex now have Multi-Mode Traction Control and MagicTwistTM for improved riding experience in city traffic.
  • Pricing starts at Rs 1,29,999 for the 450S, and goes up to Rs 1,99,999 for the 450 Apex model.
  • The scooters are powered by AtherStackTM 6, integrating advanced connectivity features including Google Maps and Live Location Sharing.
  • The range for the 450X with a 3.7 kWh battery is up to 130 km, and the 450 Apex offers 157 km range.
  • An extended warranty of up to 8 years or 80,000 km is offered, ensuring 70% battery health assurance.
“Now, with the 2025 Ather 450, we are improving the safety of the scooters with features like multi-mode traction control which is typically found in high end motorcycles.” - Ravneet S. Phokela, Chief Business Officer of Ather Energy

The 2025 Ather 450 series combines modern technology with safety enhancements, making it an appealing choice for urban commuters.
newTitle: 2025 Ather 450 Series Launched: All You Need To Know

title: MicroStrategy Continues Weekly Bitcoin Buying Spree With Another $101 Million - Decrypt
summary:
MicroStrategy Continues Weekly Bitcoin Buying Spree With Another $101 Million

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 Source: Decrypt

Software company MicroStrategy is pushing forward with its Bitcoin buying spree in 2025, today snapping up more than $100 million worth of the orange coin.

MicroStrategy spent $101 million buying 1,070 BTC at an average price of $94,004, maintaining a weekly buying trend that started in November. The total Bitcoin holdings now stand at 447,470, valued at over $45.5 billion.

  • MicroStrategy has made nine consecutive weekly Bitcoin purchases.
  • Today's purchase is significantly lower than previous weeks.
  • There are predictions that the company will hold at least 450,000 BTC by the end of the week.
  • Concerns raised about the company’s high leverage and stock valuation amidst Bitcoin's fluctuating price.
MicroStrategy has acquired 1,070 BTC for ~$101 million at ~$94,004 per bitcoin and has achieved BTC Yield of 48.0% in Q4 2024 and 74.3% in FY 2024.

In conclusion, MicroStrategy's aggressive Bitcoin purchasing strategy demonstrates its commitment to accumulating the cryptocurrency, even as concerns about market stability rise.
newTitle: MicroStrategy Continues Weekly Bitcoin Buying Spree With Another $101 Million

How 16.73 billion UPI transactions killed the ubiquitous toffee business | Mint - Mint
summary:
How 16.73 Billion UPI Transactions Impacted India's Toffee Business

Publication Date: December 2024

Source: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI)

India's Unified Payments Interface (UPI) transactions soared to 16.73 billion in December 2024, profoundly affecting the traditional toffee or candy business.

  • UPI transactions increased by 8% month-on-month, compared to 15.28 billion transactions in November 2024.
  • The cultural practice of giving candies as change has declined, impacting toffee sales.
  • Approximately 30 million small shops in India were affected by this shift in transaction methods.
Harshad Shah, a chartered accountant, stated: “Before UPI, shopkeepers would trade Toffees for small change, stating shortage of Coins.”

As digital payments grow in prevalence, the toffee industry's fortunes hinge on changing consumer behavior and payment methods.
newTitle: How 16.73 Billion UPI Transactions Impacted India's Toffee Business

title: Upcoming IPO: BPCL's update on joint venture company's Rs 1000 crore public issue - Details - ET Now
summary:
Upcoming IPO: BPCL's update on joint venture company's Rs 1000 crore public issue

Updated: Jan 6, 2025 Source: ET Now

Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) has announced the upcoming public issue of its joint venture company Maharashtra Natural Gas Limited (MNGL) with plans for an IPO aimed at raising over Rs 1000 crore.

  • MNGL is a city gas distribution joint venture comprising BPCL, GAIL (India), and Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL).
  • The IPO is expected to include an offer for sale (OFS) and a fresh issue of shares.
  • IGL currently holds 50% of MNGL, with BPCL and GAIL each owning 22.5%.
  • The IPO proceeds are forecasted to be used for expanding operations in various regions.
  • MNGL has a significant infrastructure, including 246 CNG stations and almost 858,000 domestic piped natural gas connections.
  • Upon listing, MNGL would be the sixth pure-play city gas distribution entity to go public.
"It is the most profitable joint venture we have, and we plan to unlock value for investors. MNGL will raise over Rs 1,000 crore. The proceeds will be used to expand operations," an official stated.

This move marks a significant step for BPCL and its partners as they navigate the capital markets to enhance their growth strategies in the energy sector.
newTitle: BPCL Updates on Upcoming Rs 1000 Crore IPO for Joint Venture Company

title: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance enters new market with Rs 10 product, big challenge to Tata firm - DNA India
summary:
Mukesh Ambani's Reliance enters new market with Rs 10 product, big challenge to Tata firm

Publication Date: January 6, 2025

Source: DNA India

Mukesh Ambani continues to expand his business empire with the introduction of a new rehydrating beverage, RasKik Gluco Energy, priced at just Rs 10 per single-serve drink. This move follows Reliance's recent acquisition of Campa Cola and positions the company to compete directly with Tata Consumer Products in the beverage market.

  • Reliance's market cap stands at Rs 16.48 lakh crore.
  • The RasKik Gluco Energy beverage aims to redefine rehydration in India.
  • Products currently offered include mango, apple, mixed fruit, coconut water, and nimbu pani.
  • Reliance aims to expand its portfolio inspired by regional fruit varieties.
"RasKik is now uniquely positioned to provide a variety of accessible and great quality fruit-based drinks." - Reliance Consumer Products Ltd

This product launch exemplifies Reliance's commitment to merging traditional Indian consumer heritage with modern product offerings, highlighting the company's ambition to become a leader in the beverage sector.
newTitle: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Launches Rs 10 Beverage, Challenging Tata

title: FDA Proposes Framework to Advance Credibility of AI Models Used for Drug and Biological Product Submissions - FDA.gov
summary:
FDA Proposes Framework to Advance Credibility of AI Models Used for Drug and Biological Product Submissions

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: U.S. Food and Drug Administration

The U.S. FDA has released draft guidance aimed at using artificial intelligence (AI) for supporting regulatory decisions related to drug and biological product safety, effectiveness, and quality, marking a first in the agency's efforts.

  • The guidance promotes a risk-based framework for assessing AI model credibility.
  • FDA Commissioner Robert M. Califf emphasizes AI's potential to transform clinical research and product development.
  • The FDA has substantial experience with AI in regulatory submissions since 2016.
  • Stakeholder feedback was integral in framing these guidelines.
“With the appropriate safeguards in place, artificial intelligence has transformative potential to advance clinical research and accelerate medical product development to improve patient care.” - FDA Commissioner Robert M. Califf, M.D.

This draft guidance is open for public comment within 90 days, aiming for alignment with industry experiences and sponsor engagement effectiveness.
newTitle: FDA Proposes Framework to Advance Credibility of AI Models Used for Drug and Biological Product Submissions

Bitcoin Tops $100,000 for First Time in 2025 as Trump Trade Continues to Spur Sentiment - Decrypt
summary:
Bitcoin Tops $100,000 for First Time in 2025 as Trump Trade Continues to Spur Sentiment

Publication Date: January 2025, Source: Decrypt

Bitcoin has surpassed the $100,000 mark for the first time this year, buoyed by positive trader sentiment and developments in the market.

  • Bitcoin reached a price of $101,192, though it has not yet returned to its all-time high of $108,135.
  • The cryptocurrency traded below $100,000 for a nearly three-week period before this increase.
  • Factors such as the Federal Reserve's interest rate projections affected market sentiment, but optimism remains high.
  • President-elect Trump's intention to establish a U.S. strategic Bitcoin reserve is influencing investor behavior.
  • Bitcoin is seen as navigating a tactical trading range, presenting unique strategic opportunities.
“Rather than a continuous rally, Bitcoin appears to be navigating a tactical trading range...” - 10x Research

The recent surge in Bitcoin's price reflects both market resilience and strategic positioning as investors adapt to changing economic conditions.
newTitle: Bitcoin Tops $100,000 for First Time in 2025 as Trump Trade Continues to Spur Sentiment
